abstract: Online vigilantes, with varying agendas, have banded together to combat Islamic State's virulent use of social media, particularly Twitter; working anonymously, hackers expose suspect ISIS accounts on blacklists via Twitter, and ask Twitter users to report accounts to network's violations officials.
lead_paragraph: A loosely organized effort by computer hacking collectives aimed at disrupting ISIS and other violent jihadist causes began last year after the group posted images of beheaded captives.

headline.main: Behind a Veil of Anonymity, Online Vigilantes Battle the Islamic State
headline.print_headline: Behind a Veil of Anonymity, Online Vigilantes Battle Islamic State

snippet: A loosely organized effort by computer hacking collectives aimed at disrupting ISIS and other violent jihadist causes began last year after the group posted images of beheaded captives.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
